text.p: Bonds were lifted by the positive international mood, matching gains in the Bunds, but traders said that the rises were creating room for profit-taking.
The 10-year cash was seen keeping below a 90 basis point spread with the Bunds and at around five points from the Spanish equivalent.
"At these levels and in view of the volatility we have seen recently and the expectations about U.S. rate rises, it begins to make sense to take some profit," said one trader.
Nevertheless, other traders said that the trend for the sesssion seemed established and that the gains should be maintained.
They expected New York to open firm in the absence of any indicators for release in the U.S. on Friday.
The escudo appeared to have found a temporary equilibrium around 100.60 to the mark with the market wary of Bank of Portugal intervention if it weakened further. It opened at 100.53/56.
